intro: Cryptolepis macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved cryptolepis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its large, ovate leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. It has a woody stem and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Cryptolepis macrophylla is also noted for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in herbal remedies.
